DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the broad clinical benefit of dosing Seroquel XR with flexible in the treatment of acute bipolar mania patients with partial response to existing therapy. Clinical benefit will be assessed with the Clinical Global Impression-Clinical Benefit (CGI-CB) score, according to a classification based on the principles outlined in the CGI efficacy index. Improvement in clinical benefit will be defined as a decrease from baseline in CGI-CB.
DOC.brief_title: Study of the Broad Clinical Benefit for Seroquel XR With Flexible Dose as an add-on Therapy in the Treatment of Acute Bipolar Mania Patients With Partial Response to Current Therapy
DOC.detailed_description: A 4-week, Multi-Centre, Open-label, Non-comparative, Phase IV Study of the Broad Clinical Benefit for Seroquel XR (Quetiapine Fumarate Extended Release) With Flexible Dose as an add-on Therapy in the Treatment of Acute Bipolar Mania Patients With Partial Response to Current Therapy
